Exaggerate: The claim that "weed kills coronavirus" is an exaggeration as there is no evidence to support this statement.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient scientific evidence to support the assertion that cannabis can kill coronavirus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that cannabis has the ability to kill coronavirus without providing any credible evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation by stating that there is ongoing research on the antibacterial properties of cannabis, but there is no evidence to suggest that it can have any effect on coronavirus infections.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no scientific evidence to support the idea that cannabis can kill coronavirus.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting a meme as news and circulating potentially dangerous misinformation.
